::: {.question}

**Deleveraging — Shares to Issue to Repay Debt**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
set.seed(701)
shares_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 50, sd = 2))
market_cap <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 2.25, sd = 0.5))
debt_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 756, sd = 1.5))

# Calculations
share_price <- market_cap * 1000 / shares_outstanding
new_shares_to_issue <- round(debt_outstanding / share_price, 2)

```

Company Y has `r shares_outstanding` million shares outstanding and a market capitalization of `r market_cap` billion. It also has `r debt_outstanding` million in debt outstanding. The company plans to delever by issuing new equity and completely repaying all the debt. Assume perfect capital markets.

1) What is the current share price (in R$)?

2) How many new shares must be issued (in millions)?
